intro: Linaria amethystea subsp. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that are usually white or pale pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens.
